    A reference to an enterprise bean.

    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Detail

      • EjbRef

        public EjbRef​(boolean remote)

    • Method Detail

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(java.lang.String description)
        Sets a description of this EJB reference. Corresponds to the description element within ejb-ref or ejb-local-ref in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        description - a textual description of this EJB reference
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of this EJB reference. Corresponds to the ejb-ref-name element in the deployment descriptor.

        The name is relative to the java:comp/env context. For example, a name of ejb/MyBean would be accessible as java:comp/env/ejb/MyBean.

        Parameters:
        name - the EJB reference name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this EJB reference.
        Returns:
        the EJB reference name

      • setClassName

        public void setClassName​(java.lang.String className)
        Sets the expected type of the referenced EJB. Corresponds to the ejb-ref-type element in the deployment descriptor.

        Valid values are Entity or Session.

        Parameters:
        className - the EJB type (Entity or Session)
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References

      • setHome

        public void setHome​(java.lang.String home)
        Sets the home interface class name. Corresponds to the home element (for remote EJBs) or local-home element (for local EJBs) in the deployment descriptor.

        This specifies the fully-qualified class name of the enterprise bean's home interface.

        Parameters:
        home - the home interface class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References

      • setRemoteOrLocal

        public void setRemoteOrLocal​(java.lang.String remoteOrLocal)
        Sets the remote or local interface class name. Corresponds to the remote element (for remote EJBs) or local element (for local EJBs) in the deployment descriptor.

        This specifies the fully-qualified class name of the enterprise bean's remote or local interface.

        Parameters:
        remoteOrLocal - the remote or local interface class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References

      • setEjbLink

        public void setEjbLink​(java.lang.String ejbLink)
        Sets the name used to link this reference to an EJB. Corresponds to the ejb-link element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is used by the Deployer to link an EJB reference that is declared in the web application to the target enterprise bean.

        Parameters:
        ejbLink - the name of the target enterprise bean
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.2: EJB References
